Determine if sphericity assumption is met (1), something else if not met (0). What is the Sphericity Assumption? When running repeated measures the variances of the differences between all possible pairs of the within subjects variable should be equivalent. For example, if an outcome variable is measured at time1, time2, and time3, the variances of the differences between time1 - time2, time1 - time3, and time2 - time3 should be roughly the same. ç‚¹å‡»å³ä¸‹è§’Calculate, è®¡ç®—å‡ºæ ·æœ¬é‡ã€‚ ç¬¬ä¸‰æ­¥ï¼ŒReprots of power analysis éœ€è¦æŠ¥å‘Šçš„ä¿¡æ¯ï¼š
